title: (x) Serif face in Peter Rabbit books by Beatrix Potter - RabbitType {Stian Høiås (self)}
content:
Anybody? I would be so immensely greatful if someone could detect this font.

Stian

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420025326im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_quiz_4589.jpg)
author: stianhoeiaas

comments.content:
The trail's cold before we even start.

Nick Cooke
Can you provide any clues, or are you looking for a clairvoyant ID?

There are inconsistencies - the T looks thicker and perhaps not the same as the other characters, and I bet the swash crossbars are custom, especially since they don't really match. What's the source?
peter rabbit books by beatrix potter. [http://www.peterrabbit.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420025326/http:/www.peterrabbit.com/)
supposedly the font name is "rabbit type". But I can´t find it anywhere - a dead end. So I guess the font has a different name.

We've had this before, and couldn't find the answer then:

[http://www.typophile.com/node/9098](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420025326/http:/www.typophile.com/node/9098 "http://www.typophile.com/node/9098")  
 [http://dev.typophile.com/node/17203](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420025326/http:/dev.typophile.com/node/17203 "http://dev.typophile.com/node/17203")

- Lex
It is RabbitType. Owned by Penguin Books

Patzcuaro might be a suitable replacement:  
 [http://stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-34-patzcuaro](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420025326/http:/stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-34-patzcuaro "http://stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-34-patzcuaro")

Another member of this club: Retablo from Psyops  
 [http://www.psyops.com/html/spec\_retablo.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420025326/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_retablo.html "http://www.psyops.com/html/spec\_retablo.html")
